title: How should I read a book for 12 hours and never get bored? - Quora

response.answer_text: Before the how … Why? I’ve often read for more than 12 hours at a stretch … because I’m so engrossed in what I’m reading. It just happens. I don’t plan it, I don’t decide it is something that needs doing. So … why do you feel the need? If you get bored … stop. do something else. Why persevere at something that is no longer fun? Take a walk, visit a friend, watch TV, whatever … When you WANT to carry on reading, sure … come on back. Note, you never said anything about studying … but even here … studying for 12 hours at a stretch is NOT conducive to understanding or memory … you need breaks.

I’m a voracious reader and have been since I first learned how to read. As an adult (for over half a century now), I can generally read for two hours at a time without becoming bored unless I actively dislike the material I’m reading from the onset. However, to read for prolonged periods of time (such as 8 or more hours), I have to meet three criteria: The book has to seize my interest to the extent that I almost go into a trance as I read it, I must avoid external distractions (such as my telephone, loud music, and bright light as much as possible, and I need to have easy access to water, food, and a restroom close by so that I don’t break my near trance while meeting my body’s needs. Other people I know who can read for long stretches of time in one session have similar reading habits, but I have no way of knowing how representative of marathon readers we are.
